item.title: Report E-2024050000
item.description:
Report E-2024050000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a UN1719 Pentrate Ultra Liquid release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the pallet and trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Kolor-Safe was then deployed to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted pallet and absorbents were containerized into a second 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040658
item.description:
Report E-2024040658

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of sodium hydroxide was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected the damaged jug and deployed absorbents to the release. The crew worked them in with hand tools and further utilized neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to further remediate the area. All UN1824 impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum and two (2) 15-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2024040619
item.description:
Report E-2024040619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of acetone were damaged due to a pallet failure in transit. Due to the damage, the drums released approximately ten (10) gallons of acetone to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected two (2) damaged drums and placed them in 85-gallon overpack for potential reuse. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor and worked them in utilizing hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized a degreasing agent and absorbent pads to collect any residual product. All acetone impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of all three (3) drums to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE UNLOAD FOR A HAZMAT LEAKER. UPON ARRIVAL, HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS LOADED IN THE WALL SIDEWAYS AND LEAKING ON SEVERAL OTHER PARCELS UNDERNEATH. USING THE DECISION TREE, OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEET AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, PACKAGES WERE REMOVED FROM DOOR 188 AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024040575
item.description:
Report E-2024040575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: NELSONVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABC Supply Co
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABC Supply contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred at a job site located at 55 Washington St. in Nelsonville, OH. The spill consists of approximately 25 gallons of Mule Hide Low VOC Bonding Agent, which released from 5-5-gallon metal drums, due to the drums not being strapped in properly and falling over during unloading. The asphalt around the job site has been affected, no drains or waterways.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 12, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN2735 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel overpacked the damaged jug in one (1) 5-gallon bucket. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the impacted site. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon release of UN1210 "Pro® Varnish" arrived damaged at Terminal XCN. (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was shipped without the lid being secured resulting in one gallon of material impacting the drum and Trailer #317-2767. The release dried up/evaporated during transit, no waste was generated. ERTS and the caller reviewed the safety data sheet and the caller advised that the terminal personnel would be securing the lid to the drum and would be returning the freight to the shipper. Transport was managed by the terminal.
